concept.title: Cluster setup considerations
concept.shortdesc: Proper configuration of I/O subsystems is critical for the optimal performance and operation and performance of Couchbase Server.

section.title: Storage
section.p: These are the most common best practices recommended for storage configuration:

dlentry.dt: Isolate the data and index at the physical disk level
dlentry.dd: Combining different workloads (workloads with different I/O and latency characteristics) can have negative effects on overall performance.

With Multi-dimensional Scaling, you can have different disk storage configurations for nodes running the Data and Index services if this fits your use case needs. The Index servers can have SSD-backed storage for better performance.

dlentry.dt: Use RAID 1+0 (or RAID 1) if replication factor is 1
dlentry.dd: If replication factor is 2 or higher, the system administrator can rely on database-level replication for data durability.
The TCP/IP port allocation on Windows by default includes a restricted number of ports available for client communication. [see MSDN: Avoiding TCP/IP Port Exhaustion]
